WorkItem.ClosedComment: User's settings caused user to think there was a problem
WorkItem.Description:
When I mark my current items in the righthand panel with a blue diamond, I'm trying to get the organizer to only consider that gemming of an item (so that I can see what gear changes it suggests without my having to purchase new gems.)  However, even though the "Override Regem" option is OFF, the optimizer still suggests changing the gems in those items.
Â 
What am I not understanding, please?
WorkItem.Summary: Blue Diamond Does Not Seem To Restrict Optimizer To That Gemming

Comments.Message: It's possible to have an item both fully available (green diamond) and specifically available (blue diamond). Check to see if that's the case.
No, in all cases a particular garment has only one entry in the table on the Comparisons (right hand) screen, and that entry has a blue diamond.  Shouldn't this result in using the existing gemming?

It's still quite possible to be both blue and green, despite there only being 1 entry. We do fully realize that that's an unintuitive UI design, and do want to change it at some point, but it does work that way now.

OK, now I see the issue.  I had had Tools / Edit Gemming Templates / Top Gemmings To Show  set to 1, so I didn't see the other possible gemmings that were set to green by default.  When I raised that number I could see those others and turn them 'empty' so they were not considered.  That did the trick.

Thanks.
